description: This course delves into the unique history of Musical Theatre in Japan. Students explore Japanese
theatrical traditions and observe their influence on contemporary productions and pop culture.
Activities include performances of Noh, Kabuki, Takarazuka, translated American musicals,
Disneyland, and original Japanese musicals. Guest lectures from industry professionals provide
insights into training, career trajectory, and considerations for translation. The course
culminates in reflections on the role of musical theater in society, both locally and globally.
Offered alternate years during January term.
